name: I Spy Stan Lee Quiz | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: In "Captain America: Civil War" (2016), what did Stan Lee do in his cameo?
questions.correct: Delivered a package to Tony Stark
options: Picked a fight with Bruce Banner
questions.explanation:
Delivered a package to Tony Stark.

	Most people living on Earth in the Marvel Cinematic Universe would know who Tony Stark is. However, looking for a comedic effect, Stan Lee's Fed Ex character mispronounced it as "Tony Stank".

questions.text: Where was Stan Lee seen in "Deadpool" (2015)?
questions.explanation:
In a strip club.

	In "Deadpool", Stan Lee was at DJ at at a strip club. When "Deadpool" was released in 2015, it became the highest grossing R-rated film of all time.

questions.text: In "X-Men Apocalypse", what did Stan Lee say as he looked to the sky at the destruction caused by Magneto?
questions.explanation:
Nothing.

	In some movies, Stan Lee is a bystander that does not say anything. This was the first Marvel movie in which Stan Lee had a cameo with his wife, Joan Lee.

questions.text: In what Marvel movie was Stan Lee seen complaining to a security guard that "security ought to be beefed up a lot more in a place like this"?
questions.explanation:
Hulk.

	Stan Lee made this statement in the original "Hulk" in 2003. The security guard was played by Louis Ferrigno, who starred in "The Incredible Hulk" TV show from 1977 to 1981, and was the voice of the Hulk in the movie.  In the reboot titled "The Incredible Hulk" in 2008, Stan Lee was shown drinking and dropping a bottle of soda that Bruce Banner had bled into.

questions.text: In "Fantastic Four" (2005), where did Stan Lee run into Dr. Richards?
questions.explanation:
His hotel.

	In his cameo, Stan Lee said "Welcome back to the Baxter, Dr. Richards." This is of the the few cameos where Stan Lee is given a name. Dr. Richards refers to him as Billy.

questions.text: In what movie did Stan Lee say to the main character: "You know, I guess one person can make a difference"?
options: Fantastic 4: Rise of the Silver Surfer
questions.explanation:
Spiderman 3.

	In this scene, Peter Parker viewed a sign that displayed that Spiderman was given the key to the city. At the same time Stan Lee walks up to him and says "You know, I guess one person can make a difference."

questions.text: In "Iron Man 2", what famous radio host did Stan Lee impersonate?
questions.explanation:
Larry King.

	This scene takes place as Tony Stark is leaving Stark Expo after giving a speech. He passes many fans and reporters asking for a moment of his time, and Stan Lee is briefly seen as he says "Hi, I am Larry David."

questions.text: In what movie did Stan Lee dress in an army uniform and say "I thought he would be taller"?
questions.explanation:
Captain America: The First Avenger.

	Some Marvel movies do not take place on Earth or in the present, but that does not stop Stan Lee from making an appearance. This scene took place in the past during World War II, the time in which Captain America was originally active.

questions.text: In what movie was Stan Lee listening to music in a library as a battle played out in slow motion behind him?
questions.explanation:
The Amazing Spiderman.

	During this scene Spiderman fought the Lizard Man in his school and crashed through a wall into the library. Stan Lee was almost hit by a flying table but it was stopped by one of Spiderman's webs. Stan Lee's character was completely unaware of the action taking place behind him.

questions.text: In this movie Stan Lee was seen listening to a lecture at a retirement home and asking for his shoe back. What movie is this?
questions.explanation:
Thor: The Dark World.

	The lecture was given by Professor Erik Selvig, who was under Loki's mind control in "The Avengers" (2012). The scene starts with the audience only being able to see the professor. The camera then shows the audience, which included Stan Lee.
